DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric score to represent the intensity in a tissue specimen tested for the presence of a gene biomarker. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Measurable and quantifiable biological parameters (e.g., specific enzyme concentration, specific hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype distribution in a population, presence of biological substances) which serve as indices for health- and physiology-related assessments, such as disease risk, psychiatric disorders, environmental exposure and its effects, disease diagnosis, metabolic processes, substance abuse, pregnancy, cell line development, epidemiologic studies, etc_information related to the description or status of progesterone receptors, specific proteins found in or on cells of progesterone target tissues that specifically combine with progesterone, based on percentage and intensity of stained cells._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Measurable and quantifiable biological parameters (e.g., specific enzyme concentration, specific hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype distribution in a population, presence of biological substances) which serve as indices for health- and physiology-related assessments, such as disease risk, psychiatric disorders, environmental exposure and its effects, disease diagnosis, metabolic processes, substance abuse, pregnancy, cell line development, epidemiologic studies, etc

Concepts.definition: A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention.

Property.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.:a dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.
a dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numeric score of cell staining percentage and intensity to determine progesterone receptor status._Measurable and quantifiable biological parameters (e.g., specific enzyme concentration, specific hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype distribution in a population, presence of biological substances) which serve as indices for health- and physiology-related assessments, such as disease risk, psychiatric disorders, environmental exposure and its effects, disease diagnosis, metabolic processes, substance abuse, pregnancy, cell line development, epidemiologic studies, etc_The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule)._Any of the various methods that use a dye, reagent, or other material for producing coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Moderate (dark brown staining, able to observe nuclei chromatin details)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Moderate (dark brown staining, able to observe nuclei chromatin details)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Moderate grade (dark brown staining, able to observe nuclei chromatin details)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: High (dark brown staining, loss of nuclei chromatin details)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: High (dark brown staining, loss of nuclei chromatin details)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: High grade (dark brown staining, loss of nuclei chromatin details)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurable and quantifiable biological parameters (e.g., specific enzyme concentration, specific hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype distribution in a population, presence of biological substances) which serve as indices for health- and physiology-related assessments, such as disease risk, psychiatric disorders, environmental exposure and its effects, disease diagnosis, metabolic processes, substance abuse, pregnancy, cell line development, epidemiologic studies, etc:A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).:Any of the various methods that use a dye, reagent, or other material for producing coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention.
A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position on a particular chromosome and serves as the template for a product that contributes to a phenotype or a biological function.
Any of the various methods that use a dye, reagent, or other material for producing coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support St. Joseph Hospital adoption of C3D
